name: transplant
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to move something, or to be moved, from one place or person to another: The plants should be grown indoors until spring, when they can be transplanted outside. Compare
implant verb (OBJECT)

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Medical treatment: surgery
C2 [ C or U ] a medical operation in which a new organ is put into someone's body: a liver/kidney transplant transplant surgeryhave a transplant He had a heart transplant (= doctors gave him a different, healthier heart instead of his old one).
[ C ] something, especially a new organ, that has been transplanted: His body accepted/rejected the transplant.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was given a new liver in a transplant operation.She received her transplant a month ago.

transplant verb
(CHANGE ENVIRONMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I/T ] to move someone or something, or to be moved from one place to another: [ T ] I transplanted those bushes to the back of the house.
transplant verb
(MOVE ORGAN)
[ T ] to move tissue or an organ from one person’s body to another’s
transplant noun [C]
(MEDICAL OPERATION)
a medical operation in which a new organ or tissue is put into someone's body: He survived a kidney transplant.
transplant noun [C]
(PERSON/THING)
someone or something that has moved or been moved from one place to another: I’m a transplant from California.
